panels.description: if too many files opened, logstash probably to be scale-up (log messages not unstacked fast enough)
panels.title: Open files

panels.description: Duration for messages to go through all steps of the pipeline.
panels.title: Pipeline duration

panels.description: Current number of events going IN (log line) treated per second. If < 5 events per seconds, something probably wrong, filebeat containers are not sending logs or logstash is in bad shape (see cpu/mem)
panels.title: Events in

panels.description: Current number of events being FILTERED (in grok, mutate, drop, clone, ruby) treated per secondIf < 20 events per seconds, something probably wrong, in logstash (see cpu/mem)
panels.title: Events filtered

panels.description: Current number of events being going OUT treated per second. If < 5 events per seconds, something probably wrong, Elastic is in bad shape or logstash (see cpu/mem)
panels.title: Events out

panels.description: For more JVM metrics, please check 'Java Pods' dash

targets.expr: max(sum by (pod)(jvm_memory_pool_committed_bytes{pod=~"$pod",container=~"$container",pool=~"PS Eden Space|G1 Eden Space|PS Survivor Space|G1 Survivor Space|Par Eden Space|Par Survivor Space|PS Old Gen|G1 Old Gen|CMS Old Gen|ZHeap|young|survivor|old"})+sum by (pod)(jvm_memory_committed_bytes{pod=~"$pod",container=~"$container",area="nonheap"}))

max(min_over_time(jvm_memory_pool_used_bytes{pod=~"$pod",container="$container",pool=~"PS Old Gen|G1 Old Gen|CMS Old Gen|ZHeap|old"}[1h]))+max(jvm_memory_pool_committed_bytes{pod=~"$pod",container="$container",pool=~"PS Eden Space|G1 Eden Space|PS Survivor Space|G1 Survivor Space|Par Eden Space|Par Survivor Space|young|survivor"} or vector(0))+max(jvm_memory_committed_bytes{pod=~"$pod",container="$container", area="nonheap"})

panels.title: JVM Memory Used
